e0f444e8-2096-4673-b295-e33f232a62c3.description: Earners of the First Peoples' Health Yuwahn Wupin have completed 2-hours of e-learning. Earners have demonstrated successful achievement of learning outcomes by successfully completing a quiz in each of the five modules, from a federally endorsed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Curriculum Framework, which includes the cultural capabilities of Respect, Safety and Quality, Reflection, Communication and Advocacy.
e0f444e8-2096-4673-b295-e33f232a62c3.name: First Peoples' Health Yuwahn Wupin

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete each of the 5 cultural capability modules and the 6 quiz questions for each module (36 in total) to earn their digital badge.
Students must achieve a minimum score of 5 for the quiz questions in each of the modules to receive a Griffith credential for their professional portfolio records.

Students are encouraged to add the credential to a professional development portfolio such as Pebble Pad and LinkedIn profile.  Note: The achievement of this credential is a Fit for Professional Practice  requirement for Griffith Health students prior to undertaking a placement as endorsed by the Griffith Health Executive.
Go to the First Peoples' Yuwahn Wupin website for enrolment information

skills.name: Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Health Cultural Capability
Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Health Cultural Safety

70242982-2bd4-4f21-8f85-78f833390759.description: Earners of the Griffith Award for Academic Excellence badge have demonstrated high levels of academic achievement. Earners are non-award, undergraduate and postgraduate students who maintain a high level of academic achievement based on the successful completion of 40CP within the academic year. This badge represents an achievement credential type that is not for credit.
70242982-2bd4-4f21-8f85-78f833390759.name: Griffith Award for Academic Excellence - 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must have been enrolled in the same career level (non-award, undergraduate, postgraduate), and have undertaken study in two teaching periods in the academic year.

Earners' academic record over the academic year will include no Fail grades (3, 2, 1, Fail No Assessment Submitted, Withdraw with Failure), no unfinalised grades and include only graded course results (7, 6, 5, 4) for at least 40CP of courses.
Earners must achieve a cumulative career GPA of at least 6.0, calculated over the academic year excluding non-graded passes and any credit applied.

85819bf3-3de3-4861-829d-ff4abe813e26.description: Earners of the First Peoples' Health Yuwahn Wupin have completed 2-hours of e-learning. Earners have demonstrated successful achievement of learning outcomes by successfully completing a quiz in each of the five modules from a federally endorsed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health Curriculum Framework, which include the cultural capabilities of Respect, Safety and Quality, Reflection, Communication and Advocacy.
85819bf3-3de3-4861-829d-ff4abe813e26.name: First Peoples' Health Yuwahn Wupin - General

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete each of the 5 cultural capability modules and the 6 quiz questions for each module (36 in total) to earn their digital badge.
Earners must achieve a minimum score of 5 for the quiz questions in each of the modules to receive a Griffith credential for their professional portfolio records.
Earners are encouraged to add the credential to a professional development portfolio such as Pebble Pad or to a LinkedIn profile
Go to the First Peoples' Yuwahn Wupin website for enrolment information

skills.name: Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Health Cultural Capability
Aboriginal And Torres Strait Islander Health Cultural Safety

19ee5a24-acb2-46fb-948d-8ce8503f5103.description: The GUESTS (Griffith University Early Start to Tertiary Studies) member badge is designed to recognise motivated students undertaking a single course of study while completing their high school studies. Earners receive a GUESTS member badge once they have enrolled in a GUESTS On-Campus or Online or At-School course
19ee5a24-acb2-46fb-948d-8ce8503f5103.name: GUESTS Member

badge_template_activities.title: Student must be a Year 11 or Year 12 student in a Queensland or NSW high school.
Student must have an ATAR or Diploma of the International Baccalaureate-eligible student

Student must be achieving a minimum of C or Satisfactory Achievement across all subjects, including General English*, or equivalent grades in interstate ATAR or IB Diploma subjects.  Note: [*] QCAA General subjects that meet the English prerequisite include: English, Literature, English as an Additional Language, English and Literature Extension grade
Student must meet any other subject prerequisites.
Student must be enrolled in a GUESTS On-Campus or Online or At-School course

6d358ba1-ef62-40b0-a2af-2095ad8a9034.description: Earners have completed membership of the Honours College. GHC is an extra-curricular program for high achieving students providing them with experiences and skills to reach their full potential and complement their undergraduate degree. The College equips students with enhanced skills in leadership, critical thinking, teamwork and global citizenship, all which are in high demand by employers. The Alumni community connects earners and through peer support, aims to boost their professional network
6d358ba1-ef62-40b0-a2af-2095ad8a9034.name: Griffith Honours College Alumni

badge_template_activities.title: Application to the Griffith Honours College, where students are selected based on criteria including academic achievement, examples of leadership and community involvement and academic referee. Students must remain members of the Griffith Honours College until Graduation, which is when they are awarded with the Griffith Honours College Alumni badge.

Evidence of attendance, participation and progression through program content, completion of all program activities delivered in either face-to-face workshop or the equivalent online materials, and attendance at optional professional development, volunteering or social events.
Find out more information on how to enrol here

9bb19a1d-1e0a-47b0-a600-7fa6d8ccf9dd.description: Earners of the Mental Health First Aid- Trained badge have completed a 12 hour face-to-face or the blended MHFA course comprising e-learning modules and face-to-face workshop. Earners have learnt how to assist adults who are developing a mental health problem, experiencing the worsening of an existing mental health problem, or in a mental health crisis, until appropriate professional help is received or the crisis is resolved, using a practical, evidence-based action plan.
9bb19a1d-1e0a-47b0-a600-7fa6d8ccf9dd.name: Mental Health First Aid - Trained

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 12 hour MHFA face to face course or the blended MHFA course comprising e-learning modules and face to face workshop

Attendance, participation and progression through course content, completion of all course activities delivered in face-to-face/e-learning workshops. The program is developed by Mental Health First Aid Australia and delivered by qualified accredited Griffith staff.

e18b86cd-704a-45b7-9063-836ba59ced06.description: Earners have completed a 12 hr MHFA face-to-face or blended MHFA course comprising e-learning modules & face-to-face workshop. Earners have achieved accreditation through MHFA. Earners have learned how to assist adults who are developing a mental health problem, experiencing the worsening of an existing mental health problem, or in a mental health crisis, until appropriate professional help is received or the crisis is resolved, using a practical, evidence-based action plan
e18b86cd-704a-45b7-9063-836ba59ced06.name: Mental Health First Aider - Accredited

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of a 12 hour MHFA face to face course or the blended MHFA course comprising e-learning modules and face to face workshop
Successful completion of an online exam on the MHFA website.
Find out more information on how to enrol here

c13262f5-3063-4c19-bbfc-b51c6a80010a.description: Earners of this badge are in their final year of an engineering degree, and have successfully demonstrated their engagement with professional engineering practice during their engineering studies as required by Griffith University and Engineers Australia.
c13262f5-3063-4c19-bbfc-b51c6a80010a.name: Engineering Professional Practice

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must be in the final year of their engineering degree. This means that students in the standard 4-year B Eng (Hons) engineering degree must have completed at least 240CP of the courses required within their program. Students in a the 5-year Engineering double degree must have completed at least 320CP of the courses required within their program.

Earners must demonstrate they have completed the 60 days approved engineering professional practice as required by Engineers Australia. They are required to engage in a diverse range of professional practice experiences, with minimum and maximum numbers of ‘points’ or ‘days’ able to be accumulated from specific categories. Documentation will be provided to students listing how points and/or days can be accumulated.

Earners will collect evidence with an online system and submit for final approval. Students and academic staff will be able to track the student’s progress towards the overall total points required and to ensure the required levels of engagement are met.
Earners will provide documentation demonstrating how they have successfully met each of the sixteen (16) competencies listed in the Engineers Australia Stage 1 Competencies.
Earners will also supply evidence that they have conducted and reflected on an informational interview conducted with an approved industry professional.
To achieve this credential earners are enrolled in 6002ENG or have met requirements available on the Engineering Professional Practice organisation on Learning@Griffith

cfbdaad1-b6d2-46b2-bb9d-a7973abff99f.description: The Griffith Industry Mentoring Program - Industry Mentee is awarded to students and graduates within 12 months of degree completion who successfully complete all Participation Milestones in the Griffith Industry Mentoring Program.
cfbdaad1-b6d2-46b2-bb9d-a7973abff99f.name: Griffith Industry Mentoring Program – Griffith Industry Mentee

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has attended a Program information session in person or online
Earner has completed all aspects of the Program registration, EOI, Profile, Webtraining, Quiz
Earner has searched for and requested a mentor, and had the request accepted, enabling a mentoring partnership
Earner has logged interactions with Mentor on the Mentoring Dashboard in Xinspire, and logged interactions totalled a minimum of 6 hours over the mentoring period
Earner has completed and submitted Mentoring Agreement, Mid-point check-in and End-of-Program survey
Earner has attended at least one Program professional development or networking event, in-person or online
Find out more information on how to enrol here

53b242af-9d6b-426b-ac71-29fceaa3449d.description: Earners of the Griffith Honours College member badge have been awarded membership of the Honours College during their undergraduate studies. The Griffith Honours College is an extra-curricular program for high achieving students that provides experiences & skills for members to reach their full potential, & many of these experiences are exclusive to Griffith Honours College students. On graduation, Honours College members join the Alumni community designed to boost their professional network.
53b242af-9d6b-426b-ac71-29fceaa3449d.name: Griffith Honours College Member - 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Application to the Griffith Honours College, where students are selected based on criteria including academic achievement, examples of leadership and community involvement and academic referee.

Evidence of attendance, participation and progression through program content, completion of all program activities delivered in either face-to-face workshop or the equivalent online materials, and attendance at optional professional development, volunteering or social events.
Find out more information on how to enrol here

ce3939c7-92c5-4957-aa62-23b3866db94d.description: Earners of the badge have demonstrated the ability to communicate with clarity and impact. Earners have demonstrated the ability to use their communication skills to facilitate individual and collective understanding. Earners have demonstrated their ability to use communication to propel action and promote the exchange of information
ce3939c7-92c5-4957-aa62-23b3866db94d.name: Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must be able to develop and communicate information that is well structured and understood by the audience
Earner must be able to collect and organise ideas and information in an accurate, concise and logical manner
Earner demonstrates the ability to produce a range of basic business documents
Earner must be able to identify and respond to non-verbal cues
Earner demonstrates the ability to foster two-way communication for mutual understanding
Earner must be able to present information in a compelling and effective manner
Earner must complete a 500 word reflection demonstrating the above communication skills

7dcb9ec1-7787-4e6a-b0da-a5ce5930a2c8.description: Earners have demonstrated the ability to use a range of tools or methods to critically examine and assess existing information, thinking, assumptions and issues. Earners demonstrate the ability to use this information gathered to present well-reasoned insights or to make judgements.
7dcb9ec1-7787-4e6a-b0da-a5ce5930a2c8.name: Critical Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must be able to undertake basic research to critically analyse existing thinking and methods
Earner must be able to seek and gather information or feedback from all sources to inform decision making processes
Earner must be able to establish the methodology or theoretical framework to complete a routin inquiry or investigation
Earner must be able to present sound data and reasons to support insights
Earner demonstrates the ability to use inductive or deductive reasoning to test existing thinking and assumptions
Earner must complete a 500 word reflection demonstrating the above critical thinking skills

ee99ff3d-6e16-4738-87a2-6b4e25bc7310.description: Earners of the badge have demonstrated the ability to act with integrity. Earners demonstrate the ability to act in conformance with social and professional standards of ethical conduct.
ee99ff3d-6e16-4738-87a2-6b4e25bc7310.name: Ethics

badge_template_activities.title: Earner demonstrates uncompromising integrity and commitment to the organisation’s values and ethical practices
Earner demonstrates a knowledge of ethics in a specific workplace or team context
Earner demonstrates the ability to use a range of ethical decision-making techniques appropriate to the situation and people involved and appropriate to the situation
Earner can identify compliance requirements and proactively corrects practices, processes or conduct to meet the expected standard of conduct
Earner can describe accurately professional standards and compliance requirements and processes for a given situation
Earner must complete a 500 word reflection demonstrating their ethics

3bdeebac-3f7e-4277-81c4-87ae4d71e259.description: The Parents Under Pressure (PuP) program is designed for families facing multiple adversities. The goal is to support optimal child development by supporting nurturing and caring relationships within the family. It is delivered by family support practitioners, social workers and psychologists to families, typically as a home visiting program. This badge is provided on completion of the PuP training program in recognition of having achieved accreditation as a PuP Therapist.
3bdeebac-3f7e-4277-81c4-87ae4d71e259.name: Parents Under Pressure (PuP)

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in training and workshops (5 days across 8 months)
Delivery of the program to at least three families
Demonstrated competence with Parents Under Pressure purpose built Online Platform to administer standardised assessment measures of family functioning
Completion of one case study demonstrating competence in the delivery of the PuP program
View information on how to enrol and earn this credential here

a55962de-0ee0-446b-98cf-a9e597273120.description: This badge acknowledges the individual’s commitment made to their continuing professional development. Earners of this badge can provide supportive strengths based developmental and impactful coaching and feedback that encourages high performance and professional development in others. This badge is only available to Griffith University staff.
a55962de-0ee0-446b-98cf-a9e597273120.name: Manager as Coach

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in 80% of workshops and 80% of peer learning workshop
Completion of active and experience learning activities in the program
Learning through direct observation, feedback and coaching from program facilitators and peers;
Provision of example of practical application of techniques learned
Griffith staff can find information on how to enrol in this course here

f5156f3d-99f4-4226-a615-ed0cc82c9a48.description: Earners of the Mentoring badge have demonstrated high level leadership and professional skills through the delivery of peer-to-peer mentoring programs and events which support and enhance the student experience at Griffith. Griffith Mentors have exemplified student leadership skills and are significant and valued members of our campus communities. They have participated in skills training and opportunities which have enabled them to demonstrate Griffith Graduate Attributes.
f5156f3d-99f4-4226-a615-ed0cc82c9a48.name: Mentoring

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have acted as a Student Mentor Volunteer. Student mentors assist less experienced students develop their capabilities and provide peer support.  Student mentors share their knowledge, skills and experience.

Earners have completed the Central Mentor Training Program. This training builds skills and understanding around Griffith support services and provides robust training in facilitating groups, cultural diversity, communication, online mentoring, interpersonal skills, academic integrity, consent, inclusiveness and disability awareness.
Earners have been nominated by the Mentoring Program Coordinator through the Reward and Recognition campaign
How to register to become a mentor

9f6d9663-3ce2-439a-9d36-ca11cd1164ea.description: Earners have completed the SBS Inclusion Program that contains a suite of online training courses that help organisations embrace diversity and promote a safe, happy, and productive workplace. Earners have an understanding of workplace inclusion, diversity policies and inclusive practices and the importance of recognising unconscious bias in the areas of core inclusion, LGTBIQ+ inclusion, gender equality, disability, culture and age.
9f6d9663-3ce2-439a-9d36-ca11cd1164ea.name: Inclusion at Work

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed a total of 9 hours 45 minutes of self-directed Professional Development and 6 self-paced online Courses which includes watching a number of videos and undertaking a series of online interactive reflections and activities.

Earners who have completed the Core Inclusion course have improved their understanding of inclusion and the principles guiding the right conditions for every individual to achieve their full potential. The course takes approximately 2 hours and 15 minutes to complete in total, and it is split into 5 modules.

Earners who have completed Culture course have covered areas such as cultural differences and similarities, cross-cultural communication, cultural adaptation, and population trends and their impact in Australia. Earners have gained practical skills and culturally specific knowledge for use in the workplace and everyday life. The course takes approximately 2 hours to complete in total, and it is split into 5 modules.

Earners who have completed the LGBTIQ+ course have improved their understanding of the LGBTIQ+ community. They have also been provided with the tools to apply their knowledge to promote a fairer, more LGBTIQ+ inclusive society. The course takes approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes to complete in total.
Earners who have completed the Gender course have improved their understanding of gender equality in the workplace. The course takes approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes to complete in total.

Earners who have completed the Disability course have improved their understanding of disability and can show how employment options for people with disability can be improved and embraced. The course takes approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes to complete in total, and it is split into 3 modules.

Earners who have completed The Age course will be able to identify age-related discriminatory practices that are prevalent today. They have examined assumptions made about older and younger workers, the benefits of having a multi-generational workforce, and how organisations can be more age inclusive. The course takes approximately one hour to complete in total.
Earners have self-enrolled into the SBS Inclusion Program (20180303) Organisation via Blackboard

87eb47f3-1ad7-45de-b278-0728e406eb1d.description: Earners of this badge have developed knowledge & personal insight into management approaches and applications. Earners of the badge go through theory, practical, experiential & reflective exercises that enable them to apply the knowledge & skills within their teams & in the workplace. Topics include: Management & Leadership, Managing High Performance teams, Managing Change, Managing Difficult Situations & Managing the Team Environment. This badge is only available to Griffith University staff.
87eb47f3-1ad7-45de-b278-0728e406eb1d.name: Managing at Griffith

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance and participation in at least 80% of the program modules
Completion of active and experience learning activities in the program
Learning through direct observation, feedback and coaching from program facilitators and peers;
Participation in group project work
Provision of example of practical application of techniques learned

04571ad1-78d6-408e-a06e-8484e373a3a6.description: Earners have completed the 3-day intensive MATE Bystander Train the Trainer program. They have a full understanding of topics covered on the prevention of gender-based violence. Earners have explored in depth, the issues of racism, discrimination, bullying & harassment in the workplace & community. Earners have been assessed & accredited to facilitate workshops for peers/colleagues/students in their organisation. Earners are passionate advocates for change.
04571ad1-78d6-408e-a06e-8484e373a3a6.name: MATE Program - Accredited Trainer

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of MATE Train the Trainer workshop
Completion of subsequent refresher training every 12 months

Earners are rigorously assessed on their ability to facilitate MATE content and learning activities. This includes tasks such as the design and delivery of a simulated workshop, preparation and planning of an interactive activity and the materials used during their workshop presentation. Earners received formative and summative feedback throughout the workshop and on completion. Earners have successfully completed their face-to-face assessments and received their accreditation.
Find out more information on how to enrol here

b8e2ef76-e1dc-42eb-a057-3dbc3a601e1d.description: Earners of this micro-credential have enhanced their understanding of young adolescent learners and how this knowledge informs teaching and learning practices, including implications for transition, parent and community engagement, and the role of teachers as agents of change. Earners have demonstrated confidence and capability to enable young learners to optimise their engagement and improve their learning outcomes. Earners have successfully completed a professional development program.
b8e2ef76-e1dc-42eb-a057-3dbc3a601e1d.name: Understanding Adolescent Learners - Non Credit Bearing

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed a series of quizzes throughout the program designed to test the participant’s level of understanding about: the uniqueness of the adolescent learner, the developmental attributes of young adolescent learners, intellectually engaging young adolescent learners, the implications for practice for teaching and learning for young adolescent learners.

Earners have completed a series of quizzes throughout the program designed to test the participant’s level of understanding about the principles and practices of effective transition for adolescent learners, parent and community engagement for young adolescent learners, teachers as agents of change.
Earners have completed a series of module reflection exercises throughout the program focused on the topics of each completed quiz.
Earners have completed and shared a range of interactive activities with the cohort and demonstrated ability to  consider different approaches and reflection on own individual approach.
Earners have analysed a range of self-regulation strategies and pedagogical approaches to teach the strategies and detailed the strategies the participant is already using.
Earners have applied strategies for enhancing parent-school-community engagement and detailed new strategies that could be incorporated into practice, participants then share with cohort.
This course is offered through the Professional Learning Hub, find out more here

a29cdd84-5882-49a9-a1f3-f5f1e7a901e3.description: Earners have demonstrated awareness of and capability with the skills and key topic areas of Senior English with an emphasis on academic English, and the development of the language, literacy and communication skills required to successfully undertake undergraduate studies at Griffith University.
a29cdd84-5882-49a9-a1f3-f5f1e7a901e3.name: Griffith Bridging English

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have attended all 7x 3 hour tutorials
Earners have successfully completed all curriculum learning comprising set text, five online modules, in-class tutorial learning activities and tutorial tasks.

Earners have demonstrated their learning through participation in tutorials, keeping of a learning log, completion of reflection, completion of online modules and all the associated formative assessment tasks
Earners have demonstrated their learning by successful completion of three summative assessment items
Find out more information on how to enrol here

6ab3e5f4-0c90-4cba-8712-0e11462e3b19.description: Achieving Peak Athletic Performance is presented by Griffith University Sport Development. This module is aimed at people passionate about sport and exercise and looking to further their knowledge about Achieving Peak Athletic Performance. Earners gain foundational knowledge for achieving peak performance. Topics include: Communication; Goal Setting; Training Programs; and, Nutrition. Earners gain an understanding of the range of career opportunities available in the Sport Development Industry.
6ab3e5f4-0c90-4cba-8712-0e11462e3b19.name: Achieving Peak Athletic Performance

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will need to complete 6 hours of online learning including viewing reading text, viewing videos, completing knowledge checks
Earners will need to successfully complete simple knowledge checks of key concepts, e.g., short quizzes (total of 20 questions)
Earners are enrolled in the Bachelor of Sport Development and receive access to the credential via the 'Learning@Griffith' system as part of required learning within a course within this degree.

skills.name: Goal Setting For Achieving Peak Performance
Training Programs For Achieving Peak Performance

1df77f3f-1c23-4e72-8d89-304d10adf0b1.description: Earners have demonstrated an understanding on how Xero accounting software works and how to use it obtaining a final result of 75% or more in a number of tasks included in the “Practice Set” and the “Assessment Set” activities prepared by AccountingPod. AccountingPod is an educational technology resource tool for Xero that has an agreement with Griffith University to provide this online training to students of 7111AFE Accounting and Governance and 7114AFE Management Accounting and Strategy.
1df77f3f-1c23-4e72-8d89-304d10adf0b1.name: AccountingPod Training in Xero

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must complete all the tasks of the three modules of the Practice Set and complete the Assessment Set of AccountingPod.
Earners must achieve an average of 75% or more in the tasks of the Practice Set and the Assessment Set.
Results will be sent by AccountingPod to the course convenors of 7111AFE and 7114AFE courses.

7a5ae543-9c26-4ef7-abf2-2a37b48f89ea.description: Earners have completed the face-to-face/online MATE Bystander Program workshop & successfully completed the assessment. Earners understand their personal leadership, can overcome personal challenges to become an effective bystander, recognise gender-based violence (including DV & Sexual Harassment) and abusive behaviour, recognise gender inequalities in culture, promote inclusiveness, understand the impact of gender stereotypes & respectfully challenge the continuum of gender-based violence.
7a5ae543-9c26-4ef7-abf2-2a37b48f89ea.name: MATE Program - Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete the MATE Bystander Training – Online course. Earners complete six available modules. The content covers gender-based violence prevention and the promotion of gender equality.  Earners experience simulated scenarios via virtual reality in which they can choose how they may engage as a bystander. Users will also participate in number of interactive scenarios, with the objective of testing and consolidating knowledge, as well as personal reflection. The modules are self-paced.

Earners complete the MATE Bystander Training Workshop or via virtual platform delivered by a professional MATE program facilitator, or Griffith MATE Accredited Trainer. The same content that is delivered in the Online training package is delivered in a standard MATE workshop with the option to extend on the content depending on the needs of the participants/organisation.

Earners complete an online assessment of knowledge gained in the MATE Bystander Training – Online or the MATE Bystander Training Workshops.  The assessment is includes 'Multiple Choice Questions' and written constructed responses to adequately address the material, with clear alignment to the learning outcomes.
Find out more information on how to enrol here

44621d80-38d8-45af-99ad-f909496093d8.description: The Systematic Tailored Assessment for Responding to Suicidality (STARS) protocol is a person-centred, psycho-social needs based semi-structured interview. It provides initial insight into the complexities of a person’s suicidal distress and informs immediate and appropriate client care. On completion of the 2-3 day training program, participants are a licensed STARS protocol user, which represents achievement of minimum standard competency in administering the STARS protocol.
44621d80-38d8-45af-99ad-f909496093d8.name: Systematic Tailored Assessment for Responding to Suicidality (STARS)

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the badge are mental health practitioners who have completed 2-3 day STARS protocol training program.
Earners have achieved the minimum standard competency in conducting evidence informed suicide risk assessment processes; administering the STARS protocol.

Earners have  participated in reflective learning (i.e. required literature of evidence based approaches, and downloadable journal) that must be completed to inform participation in skills-based role plays during face to face medium.
View information on how to enrol in this credential here

c3f84af4-379e-4131-ac17-fd90304a89d1.description: Earners of the Griffith Mates Program badge have developed high level leadership and professional skills through the delivery of student-lead activities which enhance the international student experience at Griffith. Griffith Mates play an integral role in enacting the Griffith English Language Enhancement Strategy and evidence a strong capacity for teamwork, cross-cultural communication and the development of Griffith Graduate Attributes.
c3f84af4-379e-4131-ac17-fd90304a89d1.name: Griffith Mates Program 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must fulfill two to three allocated positions each trimester
Earners must remain actively engaged as a Griffith Mate for the duration of their academic year (two trimesters).
Earners must complete all compulsory health and safety modules prior to commencing placement
Earners must complete the Griffith Mates induction training.
Earners must engage in a range of activities such as peer mentoring, event management, orientation leadership, event assistance and community volunteering initiatives.

8a3392de-cb9f-421e-85bb-7faee3ae84cb.description: Earners have theoretical and practical foundational knowledge on the LGBTQIA+ population’s history, unique health concerns, and risks, and to develop communication skills that avoid discrimination and provide safe, sensitive, respectful, and appropriate healthcare. Learners will be competent to lead a cultural shift that respects and supports LGBTQIA+ patients and colleagues to improve patient outcomes. This micro-credential is suitable for health and social care professionals and students.
8a3392de-cb9f-421e-85bb-7faee3ae84cb.name: LGBTQIA+ Allyship training for health professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed the online training (5 hours) which includes videos, scenarios/simulations and interactive activities
Earners have achieved at least 80% in the multiple-choice question quiz which consists of 20 questions
View the Doctor and Patient theme site for information on how to enrol (link coming soon)

e7275363-7867-4dce-87de-61eb25529286.description: Earners of the Griffith Mates Program badge have developed high level leadership and professional skills through the delivery of student-lead activities which enhance the international student experience at Griffith. Griffith Mates play an integral role in enacting the Griffith English Language Enhancement Strategy and evidence a strong capacity for teamwork, cross-cultural communication and the development of Griffith Graduate Attributes.
e7275363-7867-4dce-87de-61eb25529286.name: Griffith Mates Program 2021

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must fulfill two to three allocated positions each trimester
Earners must remain actively engaged as a Griffith Mate for the duration of their academic year (two trimesters).

Earners have peer-reviewed a set calibration package & completed a standardised report that will be approved by the Calibration coordinator & considered by the course convenor of the IRU under review to enhance course quality.
7083513f-0367-46a5-b2c0-337eeac28784.name: Peer review - External Benchmarking

badge_template_activities.title: Verification of Grades Awarded:  Reviewers verify the grades awarded of the selected assessment item, commenting on whether they agree or disagree with the grade given to a sample of student work.  Reviewers provide a rationale for any deviation from the listed grade.  Twelve student samples across the passing grade bands are used for this exercise.  Verification of grades requires reviewers to have an intimate understanding of marking, grading and assessment requirements.

Analysis of learning outcomes:  Applying their knowledge of AQF criteria, Bloom’s taxonomy and discipline expertise, reviewers comment on the clarity and appropriateness of the course level learning outcomes for the course under review.  In addition, they comment on how the specified learning outcomes compare with those of units/subjects from similar universities in the same delivery year.

Review of Assessment task: Analysis of the specified assessment task entails applying knowledge and principles of constructive alignment, assessment design and feedback practices to comment on the clarity of assessment task and marking criteria and alignment of rises with the learning outcomes. As well as discussing the comparability of the assessment task and the marking criteria with unit/subjects from similar universities in the same delivery year.

Review of Assessment task (Continued): The extent to which feedback provided by the marker to the student is appropriate for student learning.  Whether the feedback enables students to make judgements on their performance and enact improvements in future assessment tasks.

Summary judgement:  In summarising their overall findings, the reviewer provides a global judgement in the calibration of the course reporting on any risks to the quality of the education provided and offers guidance on how these can be improved.

Reflection on practice: Calibration is also an excellent opportunity for reviewers to evaluate and reflect on their own courses. In many cases calibrators have reported there is a cross-pollination of ideas, where they too have strengthened their own performance by gaining insights into the practices of colleagues at other institutions.

9194c485-3cc8-4a40-8407-f26ab08281bd.description: Earners of this micro-credential have completed a professional development program focused on providing wastewater treatment personnel with a knowledge and understanding of the engineering, operational and biological aspects of the activated sludge process and biological nutrient removal systems. e8e10e11-f75c-4a15-adcb-e31792eeb742.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated skills in the set-up & execution of sporting events held by Griffith Sport. They have demonstrated that they are a reliable and enthusiastic team player, and gained expertise in the use of 2-way radio and communication procedures, practical event skills and protocol.
e8e10e11-f75c-4a15-adcb-e31792eeb742.name: Griffith Sport Event Leader 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Earners must volunteer at two of the Griffith Sport nominated sporting events within the calendar year to qualify for the credential. Earners nominate into the program via the online form, and confirm their expected attendance with Griffith Sport staff. Attendance at the sporting events will be marked by their immediate Supervisor, as well as the nominated Griffith Sport Event Crew staff member. Expected attendance, and actual attendance will be cross-referenced at the conclusion of each event.

Earners have the opportunity to be a Course Marshall at an event(s). Earners will be in charge of directing participants (through the use of verbal cues and hand gestures) along the correct course route. Earners are responsible for the control of pedestrian and vehicle access points at their designated section of the course. Earners must be on the lookout for any members of the general public who wish to use the route, and advise them to be mindful moving forward.

Earners who are Course Marshalls are required to give vocal encouragement to participants as they pass by – and also be able to let them know where the closest facilities are (bathrooms, water stations, check-points etc.). Earners must be on the lookout for unsportsmanlike behaviour from participants, and oversee the designated area of the course and remove any obstacles or rubbish before the event commences.

Students will be given the opportunity to volunteer in a secondary position, this may be one of the following roles: Presentations Assistant, Race Pack Collection Assistant, Bag Drop Assistant, Timing Marshall, Water Station Assistant, Bump-In/Out Crew, Social Media Assistant.

Earners will demonstrate their skills in radio communications protocols (there is a strict code of conduct and terminology use for event communications via radio). These skills follow these guidelines: State your name and then the person you want to contact, wait for a response, the person being contacted then responds with ‘go ahead’, the communication goes ahead. There is only one person to be speaking at any given time, and any sensitive information is to be shared via mobile communications.

All volunteers will be checked-in by the Event Officer or Event Manager to confirm their onsite attendance at the event. Each volunteer will be assigned to work under a Supervisor – this Supervisor will complete a post-event report which will outline if the badge earner did/didn’t complete all their requirements as outlined in their role descriptions. This information is cross-referenced into a full spreadsheet of all volunteers at the closure of the event.

fccefbed-9d2c-465c-a0d8-9f1ff1cefc2d.description: Earners have demonstrated via a professional development program, a FutureNormal mindset. Thus earners can help their organisations become FutureNormal - one that is fit for the 21st century, acts meaningfully in its surroundings, aims for 100% of human wellbeing & sees money as a means not an end.
fccefbed-9d2c-465c-a0d8-9f1ff1cefc2d.name: FutureNormal Mindset

badge_template_activities.title: Earners complete four modules of active learning through a range of content delivered online and face to face.  The content covers the foundations of sustainable development, conventions and fallacies of economics and business theory, FutureNormal economics and FutureNormal organisations.

Earners work in groups to submit a professional presentation that outlines a project that will help their organisation begin its journey towards becoming a FutureNormal organisation.  This presentation outlines indicative considerations of scope, budget, resourcing and timeline, and is presented to senior stakeholders of the organisation.
This is a Business-to-Business program offered to a closed cohort. Contact the Professional Learning hub to organise an offering for your organisation

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated competency across the content including knowledge and application of principles of business and corporations law.

Knowledge of the Australian legal system including sources of law, the role of legislation and the common law, the jurisdiction of the State and Federal Courts and the role of the Courts in dispute resolution. Demonstrated understanding of the key legal principles of: contract law and tort and consumer protection law; creation and operation of different forms of business organisations; legal regulation of companies and limited liability; corporate governance and decision making.

Completion of online PLUS modules that value add to every experience.

Contact the team for information on holding office within the Postgraduate Student Association

2c19e72e-e656-477a-9629-37c519c93362.description: Earners of this micro-credential have completed a professional development program aimed at challenging current work approaches, creating change opportunities, and encouraging a shift in mindset towards creating purposeful business foundations. e520be83-b768-4b31-b565-ae21aa823f33.description: Earners have been elected to the Student Representative Council (SRC) during the year indicated on the badge. Earners work to offer better services & an overall better campus life for the students of Griffith University. Earners are required to be the face of the SRC & deliver events, activities & services to Undergraduate students on Griffith University’s Brisbane & Logan based campuses.

Earners have provided feedback to build the confidence and problem solving skills of workshop participants that reflects positively and confirms the mentor has been supportive and collaborative.
Earners have demonstrated negotiation,  coaching and leadership skills and helped groups of learners collaborate to develop a viable business idea
Earners have provided proactive assistance to guide ideation, reflection and team collaboration during mentor sessions

Earners have attended pitching sessions and provided thoughtful feedback to groups regarding their business ideas

d56234be-0a72-4554-8b4c-803a9a3d30c7.description: Earners of the Agribusiness Orchard Nutrition badge have demonstrated a fundamental knowledge of mango nutrition for orchard management. They have developed a nutritional program for a mango orchard based on the plant's requirements. Earners understand macro and micro nutrients within a mango plant and their role at critical stages within the phenological cycle. They are able to examine fertiliser programs to interpret leaf and soil analysis data.
d56234be-0a72-4554-8b4c-803a9a3d30c7.name: Agribusiness Orchard Nutrition

badge_template_activities.title: Earner must attend 3 x 1 hr online theoretical workshops and complete section related activities
Earner must interview (via telephone), analyse and record the results that form the first stage of preparation for a Nutrition Program for a mango farm (4-5hrs).
An Earner will receive, from a dedicated local mango farm, nutritional data, undertake analysis and interpret to inform the planning of a Nutrition Program (4-5 hrs).
The Earner will develop a tailored nutrition and fertiliser program for an individual farm that aligns with the orchard’s needs during the phenological cycle for mango trees (6-7hrs).
This credential is offered to overseas participants taking part in the research

44063397-6154-4f9a-834d-db4d048611bd.description: This badge acknowledges the individual’s commitment made to their continuing professional development. This includes digital skills, leadership advancing international partnerships critical for navigating economic growth, engagement, innovation, and COVID-19 recovery.
44063397-6154-4f9a-834d-db4d048611bd.name: Women in Knowledge Intensive Industries

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have provided evidence of attendance, participation, and progression through the six Masterclasses that were individually tailored and context-specific for women entrepreneurs to work effectively in both Asia and Australia.

Each Masterclass has an associated SWAY page where participants are required to interact with the material on the page. The SWAY page houses a mini-lecture which they must review before the workshop; there is a video related to a topic discussed in the mini-lecture they must review prior to the workshop. Some topics have podcasts that the participants are required to interact with. Earners have reviewed three or more readings prior to the workshop.
Earners have attended a three-hour workshop where content from the SWAY page is discussed and debated and reflected upon.
Earners have participated in personalised mentoring sessions

As part of the knowledge-checking activities, earners have completed an activity at the end of the topic. The activity can be a multiple-choice question bank, reflection questions; a mini-case study is provided, and a series of questions posed that are then submitted to the topic leader. Earners have worked on a workbook prior to the workshop, and discussed their observations from the questions posed in the workbook

They can identify various impact indicators, consider indirect or spill over effects of interventions, and choose among the different methodological research approaches used for assessing impact. Earners have gained knowledge in agribusiness data collection and overall design strategy needed in impact evaluation projects.
c046c1d4-4ff3-49be-bf86-4b3f49e6a0da.name: Agribusiness Impact Evaluation

Earners have demonstrated the ability to map cause and effect relationships

Earners have been observed by 2 qualified teachers during the workshop against criteria defined in the Human Capability Dictionary

865521c7-7d95-4f1b-ab0c-6b495ab41845.description: This micro-credential will help students develop a common language and understanding of design thinking which can be used across multiple scenarios and sectors. As a human-centred approach to problem solving, design thinking introduces non-designers to the concepts of the design thinking process and also offers designers an advancement on their tried-and-tested approaches to creative problem solving. The micro-credential will use a range qualitative human-centred research methods and processes
865521c7-7d95-4f1b-ab0c-6b495ab41845.name: Design Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate an advanced level of methods and processes used in design thinking for developing solutions to problems.
Critically evaluate and discuss the purpose and establishment of design thinking mindsets in business and society.
Critically evaluate and apply decision making strategies in the iterative processes involved in the multiple stages of the design thinking.
Communicate and present design proposals and critical analysis to a professional level.
Understand and apply ethical research principles and processes in the design of systems for human subjects.
Demonstrate effective strategies for working successfully in a group on a joint project.
Practice-based Assignment Project 1: Report OR Poster.
Presentation Project 2: Group Project.

a092c391-4f3c-4bc5-89b5-29971730966c.description: Earners have an increased understanding of themselves, of interactions amongst others and of the variable contextual elements that have an impact on leadership effectiveness.
