Earners have critically examined the forces that influence outcomes to establish effective mechanisms to manage them. Earners can contribute to informed discussion on the topics of integrity and anti-corruption, and identify the issues and opportunities in the public policy space.
01dfd8e2-b53e-4d74-85a6-b9f4126dda04.name: Strategic Approaches to Integrity and Anti-Corruption

badge_template_activities.title: Earners are able to describe key characteristics of integrity and corruption and their importance to policy and practice.

Earners have demonstrated knowledge and understanding of international and Australian efforts to combat corruption in government and business, including the principles, institutions and processes that underpin these efforts.
Earners have critically reflected reflect on the forces and events that influence integrity and corruption outcomes in organisations and institutions, in Australia and internationally.

Earners have contributed in an informed way to discussion and debate about problems, issues and current opportunities for reform to integrity and anti-corruption approaches, with reference to relevant experience, examples and self-directed research.
Earners have demonstrated improved knowledge and skills in the practice of designing and implementing integrity and anti-corruption programs or initiatives in their own organisation or profession.
Earners have successfully participated in guided discussions with peers.
Earners have successfully completed a two part Research Based Assignment i.e. Research Project Part 1 and Strategy in Practice part 2

39c46ddf-61fb-4d3b-8cb9-1cb0d9dd7175.description: Earners have demonstrated successful achievement of learning outcomes in the following areas: Taxation Planning; including: Income and Deductions; GST, Capital Gains Tax and Fringe Benefit Tax; Entities; and Tax Strategies. This badge meets the FASEA National Financial Adviser Curriculum core knowledge area for Taxation.
39c46ddf-61fb-4d3b-8cb9-1cb0d9dd7175.name: Taxation

alignments.name: FASEA standards
alignments.description: This badge meets the FASEA National Financial Adviser Curriculum core knowledge area for Taxation.

alignments.name: Tax Practioners Board
alignments.description: Earners of this badge will have met the requirements set by the Tax Practioners’ Board for its 'Board approved course in Australian taxation law'. This is part of the educational requirements to become a registered Tax Agent or a Tax (Financial) Adviser.

badge_template_activities.title: Detailed knowledge of the Australian Taxation system including knowledge and application of: allowable deductions; financial planning and other professional fees; rebates and credits; rates of tax; taxation of individuals, companies and estates; and tax strategies in financial advice

b0caf8a1-1854-4bc8-9c20-b4250e3b72c1.description: Earners are exposed to the lived experience of people with a disability from the 'insider perspective'. Earners understand how disability is just one influence—sometimes significant, sometimes minor, but always fluid—in shaping the direction and quality of people's lives. Earners are committed to understanding the experiences of people with disabilities, in Australia and globally. Earners have the disability awareness to assist in providing best-practice experience and disability support.
b0caf8a1-1854-4bc8-9c20-b4250e3b72c1.name: The Lived Experience of Disability

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have described and analysed some of the historical and contemporary views on disability

Earners have place the lived experience of people with disability at the centre of their understanding of disability by reading and critically reflecting on first person narratives (including documentary, literature, artwork, blogs, videos and websites)
Earners have critically evaluated the concepts and experiences of disability, difference and diversity in society

Earners have critically reflected on their understanding of the impact of some disabilities upon some people's lives, to better understand how those experiences might influence their access to education, housing, work, relationships, and where applicable, to rehabilitation and/or disability support services

915e64b1-dcf8-4b81-8ca9-3c94a5b4c61b.description: Earners understand the behavioural and social characteristics of autism, examine changing perspectives across time and explore how the characteristics of autism may present in an individual. Earners have explored the interrelationship between family, cultural influences and autism, and can critique disability models—and their own conceptions of autism—based on a range of perspectives. Earners have up-to-date knowledge of autism and its characteristics to help them succeed in the workplace.
915e64b1-dcf8-4b81-8ca9-3c94a5b4c61b.name: Understanding Autism

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can Explain the characteristics of autism - Written assignment
Earners have constructed a profile of an individual with autism.
Earners have examined changing perspectives and understandings of autism across time.
Earners can assess the relationship between family, and cultural influences, and autism.
Earners have critiqued current models of disability.
Earners have presented clear and coherent work with appropriate APA referencing.
Earners have successfully completed a Knowledge-based test.
Earners have successfully completed a Written Assignment on  Perspectives of Autism.
test

dbe8ac50-0f06-44ed-8d0f-c0c723b18e53.description: Earners understand how financial statements are compiled, structured and presented and have the tools to assess a company and make an informed analysis of its quality. Earners know the role of financial statement information in corporate governance practice. They can record and process business transactions through the accounting cycle and prepare a set of general-purpose financial statements. Earners can explain the implications of economic events and transactions on a financial statement.
dbe8ac50-0f06-44ed-8d0f-c0c723b18e53.name: Accounting and Governance

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can identify the various elements of modern corporate governance structure and explain the importance of these elements
Earners are able to explain the role and usefulness of financial statement information in corporate governance practice when presented with a set of financial statements,
Earners are able to record and process business transactions through the accounting cycle and prepare a set of general-purpose financial statements as required by an organisation.
Earners are able to explain the  implications for various general-purpose financial statements when presented with an economic event or transaction.
Earners are able to prepare a statement of cash flows as required by an organisation.
Earners are able to analyse a set of general-purpose financial statements,  using horizontal, vertical, and ratio analysis and then draw meaningful inferences from their analysis.
Earners have submitted a log of Learning Activities Assessable Homework.
Earners have successfully completed an individual problem-solving assignment using AccountingPod.
Earners have successfully completed a final exam

327114e7-9432-4fc3-81c8-0dd84834a5f9.description: Earners understand the socioeconomic and environmental forces that impact on the condition of people’s lives in Australia and the interaction of roles and contexts that underpin their professionalism, leadership and advocacy. Earners have built skills in communication, research and leadership by exploring the interrelationship between advocacy and leadership. Earners can promote the rights, interests and needs of individuals and their families, communities and organisations.
327114e7-9432-4fc3-81c8-0dd84834a5f9.name: Advocacy and Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have examined strategies for advocacy and leadership to promote the rights, interests and needs of individuals and their families, communities and the professions in relation to equity and inclusion
Earners have used research methodologies in order to examine leadership and advocacy strategies linked to an issue of professional interest
Earners have investigated the social forces within the Australian human services sector and analyse the theories that may influence these forces
Earners have critically reflected on current issues in the human services sector and analyse the potential to influence policy change through advocacy strategies
Earners have analysed reports, proposals, policy and procedures used by human services organisations for professional advocacy including the use of leadership skills

0c21eb97-3d9b-4b38-b024-252012505f8f.description: Earners have applied qualitative, quantitative and mixed methods to field-based investigation of disease prevention, infection management, epidemiology, environmental health, health policy and other related challenges. Earners have the skills to effectively disseminate findings to stakeholders and the community. Earners use practical approaches to field studies, stakeholder communication and decision making when investigating health problems at the population, and community and medical levels.
0c21eb97-3d9b-4b38-b024-252012505f8f.name: Applied Field Methods in Public Health

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have applied qualitative, quantitative, and mixed methods to field based investigation of public health related issues
Earners have prepared and conducted field based investigations in a variety of public health scenarios
Earners have analysed, communicated and disseminated the findings of a field investigation to the stakeholders and wider community
Earners have translated theoretical concepts into practice in real life settings relating to disease prevention and control
Earners completed three (3) written assignments throughout the course mapped to the learning outcomes

4f1d32a8-e4f5-485b-b87e-8b1ccdf7d5b3.description: Earners are health professionals who want to expand their knowledge, understanding and application of learning and teaching theory and strategies to their role as a clinical or classroom teacher. Earners can select and apply appropriate learning theories and teaching strategies to create an effective learning environment. Earners have insight into complex processes integral to teaching and learning including development of teaching/assessment plans and the role of culture in promoting learning.
4f1d32a8-e4f5-485b-b87e-8b1ccdf7d5b3.name: Applied Learning and Teaching for Health Professionals

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed this micro-credential via the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies pathway or has selected a single course of study from the listed Griffith Professional micro-credentials
Earners develop a teaching philosophy that links theory to practice for their ongoing health education practice
Earners design teaching and learning strategies that are underpinned by theories of learning, learners, teaching and assessment of student learning
Earners employ evaluation methods and critical reflection to their health education practice for the purpose of continuous improvement and ongoing professional development
Earners have  successfully completed a Teaching Philosophy – Written assignment
Earners have successfully completed a Teaching plan and rationale – Written assignment
Earners have successfully completed a Critical reflection – Written assignment

41f00345-4118-48cb-bc99-e0b63f3ebea4.description: Earners of this micro-credential have completed a professional development program in applied social research methods. Earners explored the multiple facets of conducting four specific applied social science research methods in developing country contexts, including researcher roles and responsibilities, health and safety, ethics, theory, and the specific operationalisation of the four research methods.
41f00345-4118-48cb-bc99-e0b63f3ebea4.name: Applied Social Research Methods

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have successfully completed all aspects of the online training course, including completion of 4 milestone course quizzes.
Participants were required to receive an 80% completion mark or better in each quiz to be eligible for course completion.
View the Griffith Institute for Tourism website for enrolment information

1b07e584-ad1d-4e2e-8b9e-037bd899fe2b.description: Earners explore how organisations can take advantage of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and machine learning technology to increase efficiency and build resilience. Earners explore artificial intelligence fundamentals, latest developments, and use cases in building business strategies. Earners have an understanding of how new systems are designed and implemented, and the importance of understanding the ethical considerations that arise from its use.
1b07e584-ad1d-4e2e-8b9e-037bd899fe2b.name: Artificial Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed this micro-credential via the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies pathway or has selected a single course of study from the listed Griffith Professional micro-credentials
Earners have recognised how a machine learning solution solves a business problem
Earners can manipulate business data on a platform to perform simple processes of knowledge discovery.
Earners know how to represent real-world problems in logical systems and use computational logic methods to provide solutions
Using business-oriented examples, earners have demonstrated that a high-level decision process can be supported by methods of automated reasoning
Earners have generated an Ontology using the Protege client.
Earners have applied a formal ontology approach to devise a top­level description of a business context.
Earners have trained a neural network to forecast sales and devise a marketing plan using TensorFlow.
Earners have used the TensorFlow platform to build a deep learning mechanism for sales forecasting and to create  a marketing plan.
Earners have devised a practical Al solution that addresses a business challenge
Earners have conducted research and submitted a report that proposes the role of Al in a specific business application.

2268519d-b076-4b9e-972c-83160b99bcc4.description: Earners of the Certificate in Professional Studies have completed a two-course program focused on building critical knowledge and employability skills needed to stay relevant in a changing job market. Earners selected two courses from the available suite designed to address occupation and industry growth; and the most in demand employability skills over the next five years, preparing worker learners for the future world of work.
2268519d-b076-4b9e-972c-83160b99bcc4.name: Certificate in Professional Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed this micro-credential via the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies pathway or has selected a single course of study from the listed Griffith Professional micro-credentials
Earners have demonstrated ability to augment and enhance their career opportunities
Earners have demonstrated an understanding of the emerging economy and the challenges it is creating
Earners have successfully completed  two courses including related course assessments

71e444e5-d792-4de2-b5d6-35a681d029cc.description: Earners can critically evaluate the ways in which health service management adapts to the competitive and changing healthcare environment and to explore various approaches to effective and efficient healthcare management. Earners extend their change management acumen with methodologies for planning and evaluation, influencing and negotiation and their application in health services. Earners develop management skills such as leadership, quality management, communication and strategic planning.
71e444e5-d792-4de2-b5d6-35a681d029cc.name: Change Management in Dynamic Healthcare Systems

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed this micro-credential via the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies pathway or has selected a single course of study from the listed Griffith Professional micro-credentials
Earners analyse contemporary perspectives on change management.
Earners critically analyse the components of contemporary change management practice.
Earners select and apply the appropriate tools for use in change management.
Earners evaluate the impact of leadership on change readiness in healthcare.
Earners design a change management plan that considers the needs of a range of stakeholders.
Earners have successfully completed a critical analysis essay
Earners have a successfully completed a literature review
Earners have successfully completed a poster presentation

2111cac7-f85c-496d-b11a-d782cfc6412b.description: Earners have learned how to use various tools, including cleaner production assessment and cleaner production planning, to achieve sustainability goals. Earners have learned what to measure and mark to build systems that foster accountability. Earners can promote the uptake of resource efficient and cleaner production practices. Earners are responsible and adaptable professionals who are able to find solutions to complex situations to help move towards being a sustainable society.
2111cac7-f85c-496d-b11a-d782cfc6412b.name: Cleaner Production and Circular Economy

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can identify and describe key concepts and principles of cleaner production and how to undertake a cleaner production assessment and implement and maintain a cleaner production plan/program.
Earners can identify and describe the tools available for investigating cleaner production options.
Earners can critically analyse complex strategies and use them promote cleaner production practices.

Earners can apply advanced and integrated understanding of a complex body of knowledge about cleaner production practices and apply them towards promoting the uptake of resource efficient and cleaner production practices.

Earners can research, investigate and apply new body of knowledge or practice towards finding solutions to existing as well as emerging environmental problems through adaptation of cleaner production practices.
Earners can practice as a professional in cleaner production who is responsible and adaptable and be able to make judgements to find solutions to complex situations.
Earners have successfully completed a Research-based Assignment (2000 Words).
Earners have successfully completed a Research-based Assignment Assessment (4000 Words).
Earners have successfully completed an End of Trimester Examination.

b4c3d5b0-7635-4d22-af41-a6cec7b1827e.description: Earners of this badge have developed knowledge of client service standards used to deliver exceptional client service. Earners will know how to use empathy, deal with difficult workplace situations, and use strategies on building long term relationships with their clients through effective communication and building rapport.
b4c3d5b0-7635-4d22-af41-a6cec7b1827e.name: Client Service Essentials

alignments.name: PROUD standard
alignments.description: Griffith's Client Services Essentials standards are used as guidelines and to measure success. The standards are based around providing staff and students with a good services experience. This is part of the the university strategic plan to help attract and retain staff and students

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed all requirements and their completion status on all courses, modules and activities have been marked as complete
Earners have completed 3 hours of facilitated face-to-face or Teams Client Service Training
Earners have completed a 10 minute self-paced online training in Learning@Griffith on Client Service Essentials (PROUD) Service Standards
Earners have completed a 45 minute self-paced online training in Learning@Griffith on Dealing with Difficult Client Interactions and Self Care
Earners have completed a 10 minute self-paced online training in Learning@Griffith on CRM Email Guidelines
Earners have completed a 15 minute self-paced online training in Learning@Griffith on Developing a Growth Mindset

94e65fed-68df-4776-af23-091eb21096ab.description: Earners of this micro-credential have clarified the roles and responsibilities for adapting to the impacts of climate change and identified priorities to position Australia to manage the impacts of climate change. Earners were introduced to the immediate practicalities of adapting to climate change impacts in Australia and globally, and then applied that knowledge within their own field. The course provided a multidisciplinary in-depth exploration of the highly complex issue of climate change
94e65fed-68df-4776-af23-091eb21096ab.name: Climate Change Adaption

badge_template_activities.title: Gain knowledge of the types of impacts that global climate change will produce on natural ecosystems and human communities
Gain an understanding of the types of the adaptation responses which are economically and politically feasible
Gain broad appreciation of the constraints on and consequences of such societal responses
Understand the range of issues facing urban settlements and how these may adapt to climate change
Understand how local level adaptation responses are shaped by multi-level climate governance processes
Written Assignment – Group Project Data Analysis
Written Assignment – Literature Review
Peer Assessment – Group Project Peer Assessment

bb87406c-61ab-4422-b513-66f663458e19.description: Earners understand the principles of corporate crisis communication and the vital role it plays in business, government, not-for-profit organisations and public relations. Earners can apply their knowledge of risk and issue identification to advise organisational leaders across the social, corporate and political spectrum on communication strategies during crises and disasters. Earners can build an effective crisis response plan to identify and manage issues that an organisation may face.
bb87406c-61ab-4422-b513-66f663458e19.name: Communication in Crises and Disasters

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can critically apply knowledge of risk, issues and crisis communication planning.
Earners can advise organisational leaders on communication strategies during a crisis.
Earners can work collaboratively to make strategic decisions at each stage of crisis management.
Earners can apply risk and crisis communication principles within a corporate culture and structure.
Earners can reflect on the management of crises, teamwork and lessons learned.
Earners have successfully completed a practice-based assignment for a  Crisis Response Scenario.
Earners have successfully completed a problem-solving assignment by participating in a discussion board.
Earners have successfully completed a practice-based assignment by completing a crisis case study.
Earners have successfully completed a Critical Reflection Essay (written assignment).

d65a6861-7950-4ab8-b683-dc689bd34052.description: Earners have attended workshops and completed associated reflections and professional development activities, via both curricular and co-curricular learning activity. Earners have completed activities embedded in the degree program. Earners are able to begin core PLUS activities within their degree program and independently complete additional activities to work towards the three levels of achievement. Earners receive the Construction Management PLUS badge on completion of Gold PLUS.
d65a6861-7950-4ab8-b683-dc689bd34052.name: Construction Management PLUS

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have enrolled in and worked through the PLUS program at their own pace to develop a professional portfolio of their experiences
Earners have completed all the requirements for the Gold PLUS level of PLUS.
Earners have attended 10 workshops with relevant reflections and evidence.

Earners have developed a learning or showcase portfolio to demonstrate their achievements aligned with expectations of industry. Evidence of attainment is kept within a PebblePad Workbook, completion of Gold PLUS is verified by the Griffith Sciences Learning & Teaching Consultant (Employability) and approved by the Sciences Dean (Learning & Teaching).

facb6f9b-43ab-4db8-a2dc-8cf5e52b76ed.description: Earners understand the constructs related to the development of the consumer and carer movements and the recovery paradigm they championed. Earners have empathy for the needs/contributions of families and carers in mental health care. Earners demonstrate how the recovery focused approach guides consumer-driven mental health collaboration. Earners have the skills to advocate for person-centred mental health services and improved serviced provision for those experiencing mental health concerns.
facb6f9b-43ab-4db8-a2dc-8cf5e52b76ed.name: Consumer, Carer and Community Engagement in Mental Health

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the historical and theoretical constructs related to the development of the consumer and carer movements and the recovery paradigm

Earners have described the lived experience of consumers, including the perspectives of those from differing cultural or social groups, and the impacts of discrimination and stigma on individuals' lives
Earners have described the unique perspectives, needs and contribution of families and carers as partners and participants in mental health care

Earners have demonstrated knowledge of recovery focused approaches and processes for assisting people with mental illness or mental health problems, and understanding of the issues that can arise in their application

Earners have described the place of hope and empowerment in recovery and have knowledge of service models and methods to integrate these concepts into practice, particularly with regard to peer assisted services

Earners have described practical ways to foster engagement and collaboration with consumers, carers, professional colleagues and the broader community to enhance consumer and carer participation and outcomes
Earners have reflected on and described their own values and attitudes regarding people with mental illness and mental health problems, and their role as a service provider in facilitating recovery

3b00e1cb-bd47-4de4-9aab-19573ea0f019.description: Earners have examined how to design, develop and implement clinical governance frameworks for infection prevention and control programs. Earners have explored the role of the infection control professional, systems of clinical governance, infection prevention and control framework and management plans, and performance indicators for infection prevention and control. Earners are ready for contemporary, specialty practice as an infection prevention and control professional.
3b00e1cb-bd47-4de4-9aab-19573ea0f019.name: Contemporary Infection Prevention Practices

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have designed, developed, and implemented clinical governance frameworks, infection prevention and control programs and management plans that prevent, control, and manage healthcare-associated infection.
Earners have critiqued the role of the contemporary infection control professional.
Earners have understood, applied and critiqued Standard and Transmission-based Precautions in a variety of healthcare settings.
Earners have developed tools and strategies to improve compliance with evidence-based infection prevention and control practice, including infection prevention and control policies and guidelines.
Earners have critically appraised, extended, and applied management strategies that positively support clinician driven changes and influence organisational behaviour.
Earners have successfully completed 3 Written Assignments

5948a00a-2d0b-4cd3-a76c-bd8bcdc0068d.description: Earners have developed critical thinking, research, analysis, communication and relationship building skills to assess various practices and frameworks typically used in child and family services and understand how they constrain and enable participation in child, youth and family practice. Earners can challenge existing views of practice and building partnerships to find new, evidence-backed ways to tackle key issues such as mental wellbeing, trauma and family violence.
5948a00a-2d0b-4cd3-a76c-bd8bcdc0068d.name: Contemporary Issues for Children and Families

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have understood and evaluated the importance of multiple perspectives when working with children, youth and their families.

Earners have explored and considered contemporary notions of children, childhood, adolescence, family and parenting, in order to inform how such notions work to both constrain and enable participation in child, youth and family practice.
Earners have explored child. youth and family contemporary issues and related child, youth and family focused practices and frameworks.
Earners have developed critical reflective research and analytic skills.
Earners have challenged existing views of practice in order to explore new possibilities for work with children, youth and their families.

eb436699-acdf-4449-b1cd-0a8396c01361.description: Earners of this micro-credential have gained essential knowledge and understanding of primary prevention within the field of suicide prevention. They have increased knowledge of concepts that relate to primary prevention and have examined specific frameworks of primary prevention. Additionally, they have gained knowledge in secondary prevention, with a focus on examination and determination of the most effective applications of engagement techniques and suicide risk assessment strategies.
eb436699-acdf-4449-b1cd-0a8396c01361.name: Contemporary Suicide Prevention Practice I

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can describe the historical developments of prevention frameworks, the general principles of prevention, and the related concepts of primary, secondary and tertiary prevention.
Earners can explain the relationship between different primary prevention approaches and frameworks.
Earners can describe the frameworks through which primary prevention is currently interpreted and managed

Earners can explain secondary prevention (intervention) and the theory underpinning skills required in the engagement and assessment of a suicidal person in both acute and post-suicide attempt situations.

Earners can apply the concept of duty of care in reference to applying risk assessment theory and principles in a hypothetical situation, as well as the discussion of ethical considerations regarding impacts on the worker.
Earners have completed all required assessment components - Essay, Workbook Activities and Multiple Choice Quiz

f7cd0fa5-62e9-4981-954d-6100724dee6b.description: Earners of this micro-credential will continue to explore and develop secondary prevention of suicide knowledge and theory and gain the skills required to intervene and manage suicidal behaviour. In addition, students will develop an understanding of tertiary suicide prevention including themes and processes of suicide bereavement and postvention.
f7cd0fa5-62e9-4981-954d-6100724dee6b.name: Contemporary Suicide Prevention Practice II

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can describe the theory, principles and skills required in the domain of crisis intervention and follow-up/monitoring management of suicidal behaviour.
Earners can explain the processes of therapeutic relationship and the impact of working in secondary prevention on the professional
Earners can explain the ethical and legal obligations which bind practice in the field of secondary prevention

Earners can explain secondary prevention (intervention) and the theory underpinning skills required in the engagement and assessment of a suicidal person in both acute and post-suicide attempt situations.
Earners can state the key issues in the literature on bereavement by suicide, particularly at the individual, familial and community levels.
Earners can describe the theory of postvention and demonstrate the ability to apply the principles of postvention.
Earners have completed all required assessment components - A practice based assignment - critique of a hypothetical video role play, Workbook Activities and Multiple Choice Quiz

024d3c15-93d6-4d4b-962e-379423c2bdd4.description: Earners know the background and history of ideas that have shaped what is safety science and practice today. Earners have studied the research and practical insights that drove the concepts and theories about risk and safety, the accidents and societal trends that led to new developments and insights, and how these models take a limited look at the world, enabling them to do certain things while excluding others. Earners can match safety problems to solutions in their own organization and beyond
024d3c15-93d6-4d4b-962e-379423c2bdd4.name: Critical Perspectives on Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have articulated and interrogated existing ideas and theories on accident causation in complex, safety critical systems.
Earners can recognise the models of accident causation (implicitly) used in others' descriptions, investigations and safety practices.
Earners have compared and contrasted, on their strengths and weaknesses, different theoretical approaches to understanding accidents.
Earners have applied their knowledge of different theories of organisational accidents to critique current safety practice.
Earners have proposed an activity for an organisational safety function consistent with viewing people as a solution rather than a problem.
Earners have successfully completed a Log of Learning Activities - Reflective Blog.
Earners have successfully participated in a guided discussion with peers - Online Discussion.
Earners have successfully completed a short response written assignment - Written Assessment.

49bc3bb6-31a7-4dc2-aa58-a72976fd6476.description: Earners have developed a digital marketing mindset. They can apply digital marketing concepts, critically evaluate real-life campaigns and understand the benefits of an integrated marketing plan that utilises new and traditional tools. Earners use strategies supported by digital marketing concepts that will work as social media platforms evolve including communication, problem solving and data analysis. Earners are proficient at integrating media channels within a robust, evidence-based plan.
49bc3bb6-31a7-4dc2-aa58-a72976fd6476.name: Digital and Interactive Marketing

badge_template_activities.title: Earners can explain and apply Digital Marketing Concepts.
Earners can critically evaluate digital marketing campaigns, applying the Digital Marketing Concepts.
Earners understand integrated marketing plans, can identify traditional and new tools and propose strategies supported by application of the Digital Marketing concepts.
Earners display skills in the areas of communication, problem solving, and critical evaluation.
Earners have successfully completed a Situational analysis - Written Assignment
Earners have successfully completed a Digital marketing plan -  Written Assignment.
Earners have successfully delivered a Client Pitch - Presentation.

3995f6a7-fce2-464d-a744-8dcadde22226.description: Earners have analysed some of the challenges in working responsively and effectively alongside people with disabilities and their families within the context of government and community sector service delivery. Earners have considered the National Disability Strategy as one of the Australian government's political/policy responses to disability, evidence-based approaches such as positive behaviour support, and examined disability equity and access issues in work, education, and housing.
3995f6a7-fce2-464d-a744-8dcadde22226.name: Disability Inclusion

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have described and analysed the major contemporary policy and practice issues arising from disability services provision in Australia, including new and emerging Australian Government social and disability policy agendas
Earners have critiqued contemporary Australian approaches to disability legislation, policy development and services planning

Earners have demonstrated knowledge of the key issues in providing inclusive services and supports to people with disabilities and their families across a range of areas such as education, employment, housing, refugee/ migrant settlement, and others

Earners have investigated and developed an improved disability policy or service delivery response, OR provided new research-based insights into either an entrenched or newly emerging disability policy dilemma

d437043d-7158-46a0-98fd-33a9cea7aac8.description: Earners can conduct a critical analysis across a range of challenges facing the national disability sector. Earners can use their skills to empower people to innovate in the disability services space, with advocacy guided by ethics and a thorough understanding of theory and practice. Earners are well prepared to work effectively alongside people with disabilities and their families, and advocate for their accessibility and inclusion in the social, political and cultural context.
d437043d-7158-46a0-98fd-33a9cea7aac8.name: Disability Theories and Approaches

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have described the history of disability in western culture - including Australia - and identified some of the key contemporary global challenges of disability.

Earners have described and analysed some of the theoretical, philosophical, historical and ethical perspectives of disability that influence policy development and service delivery, not only in the disability sector, but also in other fields of enterprise such as education, employment, health and rehabilitation, housing, ageing and so on.

Earners have discussed, critically analysed and contributed to contemporary debates across a range of issues - including the implementation of the NDIS in Australia, together with inclusive education and fair employment - that have an impact on the lives of people with disabilities.

Earners have analysed the usefulness of adopting an interdisciplinary approach to understanding disability and the lives of people with disability, and apply their analysis to their professional practice.

Earners have critically reflected on their own response to disability and articulate the role of human service workers in advancing the rights of people with a disability and broadening their participation in society.
Earners have successfully completed a Research-based Assignment.

db05a704-8c71-493f-8bc6-e7a875efb316.description: Earners understand disaster management and risk assessment. They can create socially focused, sustainable strategies to anticipate and respond to natural disasters that build community resilience and minimise risk. Earners can identify and mitigate existing social, economic, environmental and political vulnerabilities to ensure situations don’t escalate. Earners work effectively in emergency management, disaster operation planning, project development and community resilience-building.
db05a704-8c71-493f-8bc6-e7a875efb316.name: Disaster Management and Resilience Building

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have enhanced knowledge and understanding of different types of disaster phenomenon and their impacts.
Earners demonstrate an understanding of the concepts of disaster risks and all its dimensions.
Earners can enhance knowledge and understanding of public health consequences in the aftermath of disaster events.
Earners demonstrate understanding of disaster management cycle and the interconnectedness between stages.
Earners have an enhanced understanding about the social dimension of disaster management and community participation approach in managing the risks of disasters.
Earner is familiar with the progress of global agenda on disaster risk reduction and its application at local levels.
Earner has developed the skills needed to design projects related to disaster management and resilience building.
Earners demonstrate the ability to identify and evaluate the underlying risks factor of disasters.
Earners have successfully completed an Emergency Response Plan - Written Assignment .
Earners have successfully delivered a presentation on the Disaster risk profile of a community.
Earners have successfully completed a Community resilience project planning - Planning Document.

2e2e5525-cfe1-4bc2-9ee3-058b1d932ce4.description: Earners have developed the concept of sustainable water resource management in reference to scale, equity and efficiency criteria. Earners consider conditions under which markets fail to allocate water resources efficiently and form the basis for designing appropriate economic methodologies to allocate scarce water resources amongst competing uses. Earners apply learnings to real-world situations such as urban water supply, water in agriculture, water and health, and water in environmental uses.
2e2e5525-cfe1-4bc2-9ee3-058b1d932ce4.name: Economics for Water Resource Management

Earners have successfully completed a core knowledge quiz
Earners have successfully completed an open book and constructed responses exam
Students can enrol in this micro-credential through Griffith Professional either as a single course of study or through the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies.

111fdd51-ba7e-43f4-b683-3fcf22f99136.description: Earners have been prepared to prevent and manage disasters and pandemics in both hospital and field settings. Earners are able to demonstrate advanced knowledge relating to disaster and pandemic preparedness, response to, and management of these events.
111fdd51-ba7e-43f4-b683-3fcf22f99136.name: Emerging Issues in Disaster and Pandemic Planning, Response and Management

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has completed this micro-credential via the Graduate Certificate in Professional Studies pathway or has selected a single course of study from the listed Griffith Professional micro-credentials
Earners critically discuss the principles of disaster management and pandemic responses that underpin emergency preparedness in the local context

Earners have completed a written assignment discussing principles of disaster management and pandemic responses
Earners have participated in guided discussion with peers
Earners have completed a written assignment to assess and evaluate disaster and pandemic risks

53fe5b18-0e32-4f18-a582-bcf536848b1a.description: Earners have built on their existing knowledge of electromagnetic fields and propagating systems, as well as electric circuits, to explore theory underlying a variety of energy technologies and the ways in which they can be harnessed to improve efficiency and adaptability of energy systems at the domestic and industrial level. Earners have learned through hands-on laboratory experiences, Earners can work in project management to implement each of the energy types explored during their classes.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners understand the theory underlying each studied energy technology.

Earners have successfully completed a Research-based Assignment - Energy Audit Assignment.
Earners have successfully completed a Laboratory Report.
Earners have successfully completed an Efficient energy research paper assignment.
Earners have successfully completed an Exam - constructed response.

6d2f6914-15a1-4610-b7fb-d2071e5dd5dd.description: Earners can deliver outstanding, evidence-based, person-centred care to expectant mothers and families. Earners have the skills to facilitate optimal birth, evidence-based perineal care, advanced postnatal care and manage maternal emergencies. Earners have insight into how to improve systems and evaluate challenges in maternity care practice. Earners can take on leadership positions in midwifery while advancing their capacity as registered midwives to provide holistic, woman-centred care.

Earners have demonstrated the ability to critically reflect on and provided solutions to complexities encountered in clinical practice
Earners have evaluated the relationship between research evidence and clinical practice
Earners have used advanced knowledge and skills relating to normal birth. maternal emergencies, perineal care and postnatal care to provide holisitic, woman-centred, evidence based care

737e81f2-2cc3-4217-86f0-7ee5a532e4c3.description: Earners have completed a program designed to build learning of how to do business with an Entrepreneurial Mindset for the 21st Century. Key topics covered included: business strategy, sustainable mindsets, innovation for impact, consumer behaviour, leadership, entrepreneurial challenges, business life cycles, finance, marketing and digital innovation.

Earners must complete the online learning modules and assessment tasks

31928c1d-0cc4-4d35-a450-52d1508e3116.description: Earners understand current global ecological crises and have developed their own frame of reference for considering public health issues and interventions. Earners have worked collaboratively with peers to use critical thinking to examine recent population trends and challenges. Earners have examined 21st century global, social and environmental threats to population health including demographic changes, disease trends, urbanisation, climate change, inequality and consumption growth.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have described global population trends including health and disease patterns.

Earners have successfully facilitated and contributed to primer

Earners have successfully posted responses to primers - Part 2.
Earners have successfully completed their end of semester exam.

2bbd9a58-15bf-46f5-ba0c-513539f1f6a9.description: Earners have an understanding of the importance of epidemiology to both health research and the practice of public health and clinical science. Earners understand the public health importance within Australia and overseas of collecting and interpreting epidemiological data. Earner learning has been reinforced by practical examples and critical evaluation of health-related literature. Earners have strengthened their competence in health research and problems solving in professional practice.

7bdfa21f-3153-4a29-ac89-907b5518a48e.description: Earners can justify their plans, strategy, tactics and outcomes with hard numbers. They use data analysis to show the impact of their tactics on the business’ bottom line, linking marketing activity to financial outcomes.

Earners have successfully completed a Problem Solving Assignment  - Case Study 1: CLV Analysis.
Earners have successfully completed a Problem Solving Assignment - Case Study 2: Conjoint Analysis.

7123ba43-7d19-4397-a727-83933c6d2081.description: Earners understand the importance of cause analysis, gap analysis and impact assessment. Earners can design, plan and conduct a program evaluation and engage in informed speculation about the shape and substance of high performance policy planning and practice.

5c810290-6489-4b13-8eca-520c85d94416.description: Earners have focussed on key topics including user research, user testing, customer journeys, user flows, personas, prototyping and qualitative data gathering. Demonstrated understanding of the economic environment, regulatory environment and provision of financial advice.

df4430d7-5f39-4646-89f2-acc11156b75b.description: Earners have theoretical and practical foundational knowledge on positive behaviour support (PBS), a person-centred framework focused on providing support during times of challenging behaviour. This micro-credential is suitable for workers, carers and staff responding to behaviours of concern.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have completed 35 hours of independent, online learning and readings

b4db0314-21de-436d-9d11-9d656ce85542.description: Earners of this micro-credential have completed a course focusing on the importance of cyber security, common risks, and procedures for risk mitigation. Earners were introduced to the basic cyber security concepts and the common architectures used as industry standards. Earners studied different types of security threats, including malware and the potential attack vectors such as viruses and trojans, and existing techniques for managing security issues and maintaining the working environment.

badge_template_activities.title: Identify and analyse possible vulnerabilities in cyberspace

Written Assignment – Case Study
Exam

152f3a5e-99ac-4424-9d5b-ba0d90eeb3bf.description: Earners know the key drivers and contradictions of global competitiveness and the ways in which social pressures and calls for accountability have influenced how MNCs and other organisations do business. 152f3a5e-99ac-4424-9d5b-ba0d90eeb3bf.name: Global and Corporate Social Responsibility

f0ba7ea8-c428-4fd9-872c-2d260afa99d6.description: Earners explore the way history and theoretical concepts surrounding human rights and equity have been integrated into public health practice, in peace and conflict, including through community engagement and advocacy, relationship building, and community mobilisation. Earners have reflected on and synthesise the concepts and processes underlying rights-based approaches to public health and their use and evaluation in policy and practice in order to design a rights-based strategy.
Earners have successfully completed a Research-based Assignment Case Study - Part 1.
Earners have successfully completed a Problem Solving Assignment Advocacy proposal, discussion and action.
Earners have successfully completed a Written Assignment -  Case Study Part 2.

616124f2-608c-440c-997e-9840d0bf5a62.description: Earners have an understanding of health system elements and their intersections with population health goals examining global, national and local drivers and policy development issues for population health, systems partnerships and population health leadership concepts. 616124f2-608c-440c-997e-9840d0bf5a62.name: Global Health Systems

Earners describe global health, some existing global health issues and challenges.

Earners have successfully completed a Health System analysis: Literature summary – Research based assignment
Earners have successfully completed a Health system analysis: Final report – Research based assignment

cd303a0a-6756-422b-bf44-708bc35a6b74.description: Earners can help build prevention structures that safeguard communities from danger from uncontrolled infection. Earners have a broad understanding of how to structure prevention methods in civil society with a focus on resilience and with understanding of the needs of the varying demographics within society. Earners can evaluate the risks posed by key contemporary global health issues such as biosecurity, biowarfare, emerging infectious diseases, antimicrobial resistance, and health behaviour.
cd303a0a-6756-422b-bf44-708bc35a6b74.name: Global Issues in Infection Prevention & Control

badge_template_activities.title: Earners have critiqued contemporary infection prevention and control activities and responses to the global health context from a One Health perspective.

Earners have examined and discussed the role of the International Health Regulations and the response to global outbreaks.

Earners have successfully completed a critique of a global outbreak - Written Assignment .

24222bf2-579c-437f-9113-792adad31e36.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated skills in the administration and execution of events held by Griffith Sport. They have been involved in event planning and have a preliminary understanding of the different stakeholders and processes involved in delivering successful events. They will have experience in not only the administration and planning aspects, but also in onsite liaison, through to post event debriefing.
24222bf2-579c-437f-9113-792adad31e36.name: Griffith Sport Event Internship 2022

badge_template_activities.title: The student must submit their resume and a covering letter addressing their suitability for the role based on the Position Description (PD) provided
The student must complete an interview with two Griffith Sport team members and be successfully appointed to the Event Internship by the Event Manager.

The student will need to complete the event administration for 1 x week of events in the 'What’s On At Griffith' calendar. This will require them to complete supplier confirmations, run sheets, contact sheet, status sheet, schedule social media promotional content, layout maps, print & assemble event folders & write a post event wrap-up article.

Each student must participate in one onsite event where they will manage stakeholders, liaise with casual staff, bump-in event equipment, operate the event & any activities as required, answer queries from event patrons, bump-out equipment and complete a post event report. This activity will be done in conjunction with the Event Officer, or a suitable senior Casual Staff member.

Students must attend the office (or designated onsite location) 1 x day per week during Week 1 – Week 12 of the nominated trimester, an 80% attendance rate is required to be eligible to receive the badge. Attendance will be recorded by the Event Manager or Event Officer.

Interning students are overseen by the Event Manager. On conclusion of the internship the Event Manager completes Skills Assessment (Rating range 1-5). Students require average score of 3/5 to be eligible to receive a badge. Assessment areas include oral & written communication, initiative, staff interaction, attitude, dependability, ability to learn, planning & organisation, professionalism, quality of work, creativity, productivity, appearance & adaptability to organisations' culture/policies.

d2204bac-c6a1-46f4-ac4a-d22740bd6028.description: Earners have the skills to understand and apply fundamental concepts such as best-practice financial modelling and planning, to health management. acbf3e0f-4c6d-46d4-b2a7-cd726f325e82.description: Earners of this micro-credential have developed a better understanding of how data informed decision making is an important function of sound leadership and management. 84e76900-2cba-4187-b7dd-4e0ad556b9d8.description: Earners have developed critical analysis skills while examining the structure/distribution of the health workforce. New ways of thinking about young children, youth and families are explored.

45635f29-f552-4df1-b6f6-3cb3c41366a5.description: Earners know core scientific concepts affect disease transmission, diagnosis and management. 4035624d-d0b8-4d27-b041-880084d12f79.description: Earners have explored ethical, social and legal dilemmas in Information technology faced by IT professionals. They can use their knowledge to generate alternative solutions to ethical dilemmas.

Earners have analysed ethical conflicts facing computing professionals by applying models of ethical decision making.
Earners have applied normative ethical theories to analyse ethical dilemmas relevant to the IT professional in order to generate alternative solutions.

Earners have reflected upon the role of professional associations, especially the relative value of professional codes of conduct, and the ability to reason from professional standards to practical applications.
